top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic Collegiate Gravel Nationals' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
When someone attacks on Texas Panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Collegiate Gravel Nationals' Texas Panhandle gravel (80%), Dirt roads (20%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
79ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Texas Panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Collegiate Gravel Nationals, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At Collegiate Gravel Nationals, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
62 miles on Texas Panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Collegiate Gravel Nationals. Train it until it feels boring.
Varied gradients on Texas Panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,921ft of climbing on Texas Panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt does to your power file on race day.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Collegiate Gravel Nationals’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Collegiate Gravel Nationals requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt to build confidence. Expect: texas panhandle gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%), rolling plains.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, VO2max, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 62 miles of texas panhandle—rolling plains, red dirt in Turkey, Texas.
